alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 24 at 7:41PM CDT until September 24 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WILLIAMSON COUNTY... At 741 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Florence, or 11 miles northwest of Serenada, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Jarrell, Florence, Andice, and Sun City. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
